intro: Cnidium jeholense, commonly known as the Jehol cowplant, is a flowering plant native to northern China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has slender, hollow stems and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters at the top of the stems. Cnidium jeholense is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks.
